entries.name: Age
entries: Dwarves mature a little slower than humans, reaching adulthood between 20 and 25 years, they never lose their innate hardiness until death approaches. As a result, some dwarfs can get up to 140 years old.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Dedicated Crafter
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with one tool of your choice.

entries.name: Impeccable Memory
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on all INT-{@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} to recall information about something.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against poison, and you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} against poison damage.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish.

entries.name: Age
entries: Elves mature at about the same rate as humans, but never fall victim to the frailties of old age. As a result, some elves can get up to 150 years old. There are rumors of elves several centuries old, or even immortal. However, these have never been confirmed.

entries.name: Size
entries: Elves are slightly taller than humans, some grow up to well over 6 feet. They are built more slender, however, and thus tend to be lighter in comparison. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to twilit forests and night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against being {@condition Charmed|Ishiir}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Trance
entries: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental excercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish.

entries.name: Age
entries: Draaken have inherited some of the longevity of their Dragon forefathers. Although able to walk early after hatching, they age slowly, reaching adulthood at around 30-40 years, with variation mostly dependant on scale color. Draaken can almost reach 200 years of age.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Lawful Neutral. Draaken value tradition and order. They are focused on the task that was assigned to them at their birth by the Conclave, rarely interfering with anything outside their lands. Those Draaken that deviate from the norm, usually tend towards extremes, either becoming champions of good or perpetrators of great evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Draaken are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your draconic heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: Your draconic ancestry gives you special abilities. Choose a type of dragon from the table below. The type you choose influences your breath weapon and your damage {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Knowledge of the Ages
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill history} and {@skill arcana} skills.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines size, shape, and damage of the exhalation. Every creature in the area of a effect needs to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} against a DC of 8 + your CON, INT, or CHA modifier (your choice) + your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}. The damage equals {@damage 4d6} on a failed save, and have as much on a successful one. The damage increases by {@dice 1d6} at levels 6, 11, and 16.
After you use your breath weapon, you can't use it again until you complete a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Fighter, Wizard, Sorcerer

entries.name: Draaken Names
entries: Male Names: Aras, Bodunayn, Eozzeg, Fryrdonth, Guthorth, Myzentig, Piargesdu, Qiervass, Reseirin, Xulzrunan
Female Names: Aissain, Chenisselth, Faimaydis, Gyrmulth, Indriedul, Nethaphat, Qaphy, Samrossu, Tiepynth, Yrrosse
Task Name: Fishherder, Graingrower, Hearthbuilder, Pathfinder, Scrollscriber, Spellbinder, Steelforger, Taskbinder, Wallwarder, Wordbearer
Name Generator

entries.name: Age
entries: Gnomes mature at the same rate as humans, their lifespans, however, tend to be longer. A gnome can reach almost 150 years of age.

entries.name: Size
entries: Gnomes average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on all INT, WIS, and CHA {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against magic.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnomish.

entries.name: Age
entries: Harfolk age slightly slower than humans, and reach adulthood sometime in their twenties. They grow slightly older too, averaging a lifespan of about 80 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Chaotic Good. Harfolk strive above all to live life to its fullest and accomplish heroic deeds worthy of song and legend. Some Harfolk clans can support a more Lawful bend, based on a particular of code of honor or valued traditions.

entries.name: Size
entries: Harfolk are by far the largest race on the face of Ishiir. An average Harfolk reaches heights of over 8 feet and weighs over 300 pounds. Your size is Large. This does not increase the size of your weapon damage die.

entries.name: Natural Athlete
entries: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Athletics} skill.

entries.name: Harfolk Hardiness
entries: When you take damage, you can choose to use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to shrug off the blow. Roll a {@dice d12} + your CON modifier. And substract the result from the damage taken. You can't use this feature again until you have finished a {@variantrule Short Rest|Ishiir|Short} or a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: Your are acclimatized to cold regions as per the DMG. You also have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to cold damage.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Giant.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Barbarian, Druid, Bard

entries.name: Harfolk Names
entries: Male Names: Authulf, Bjalfi, Glum, Hafgrim, Ingifast, Njal, Orlyg, Skeggi, Thorgaut, Vebjorn
Female Names: Alfdis, Drifa, Gyda, Halla, Ingigerd, Jorunn, Osk, Skuld, Thorgunna, Vigdis
Last Name: Name of parent with greater achievements + s + son (male)/dottir (female)
Name Generator

entries.name: Age
entries: Forest Owls reach maturity at about 1 years old and can live to around 30.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: Forest Owls can grow up to a little over 1 foot tall, with a wingspan around 3 feet. Your size is tiny.

entries.name: Limited Flight
entries: You have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|Ishiir} of 50 feet, but you must end your movement on a surface you can stand on.

entries.name: Flyby
entries: You don't provoke {@action Opportunity Attack|Ishiir|Opportunity Attacks} when you fly out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to twilit forests and night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Silent Flight
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Stealth} skill.

entries.name: Speak with Beasts
entries: You can communicate with other beasts as if you were sharing the same language.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read and, write Common and one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Half-Elves mature at the same rate as humans, but live longer thanks to their Elven heritage. A Half-Elf can get close to 100 years old.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Similar to Humans, Half-Elves have no innate tendencies towards any alignment, and instead adopt one based entirely on their personal experiences.

entries.name: Size
entries: While they inherit some striking features from the Elven half of their parents, Half-Elves tend to be closer in build and height to Humans. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in two skills of your choice.

entries.name: Lesser Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your Elven heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 30 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against being {@condition Charmed|Ishiir}, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Mixed Heritage
entries: Choose the single strongest influence of your parentage from the following:
Human: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in one skill
High Elf: You gain the Cantrip racial trait.
Wood Elf: You gain the Mask of the Wild racial and Fleet of foot racial traits.
Dark Elf: Your gain the Dark Elf Spellcasting trait, excluding Healing Spirit.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish, and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Any.

entries.name: Height and Weight
entries: Roll for height and weight for both of your parents and then take the average for each.

entries.name: Age
entries: Orcs mature slightly faster than Humans, reaching adulthood in their early teens. They also age noticeably faster. An orc rarely lives past his 60th year.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Chaotic Neutral. Orcs are belligerent and quick to anger, always ready and willing to solve a conflict with violence.
They do, however, adhere to a code of honor, such as not using backhanded tactics or killing children. Orcs value and respect displays of great strength and glory, but find little value in laws.

entries.name: Size
entries: Orcs are taller and much bulkier than humans. They easily surpass 6 feet in height and average over 200 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Fearless
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against being {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Tireless
entries: If you gain a level of {@condition Exhaustion|Ishiir}, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} to remove it. You can't use this ability again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Furious Charge
entries: Once per turn, as part of a melee weapon attack, you can move up to your {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} in a straight line towards a target of your choice.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice (and only the weapon's own damage dice) again and add the result to the total.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Orcish.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Barbarian, Ranger, Druid

entries.name: Orc Names
entries: Male Names: Angul, Brall, Ghamzull, Lonzag, Mavar, Ondok, Rhohzak, Uzzok, Xurl, Zutrall
Female Names: Auvi, Bhedkua, Himdi, Kyel, Memvual, Nef, Oddil, Rhilve, Seemo, Vaatu
Clan Names: Blackclaw, Boneshatter, Deathwind, Eyegouger, Frosttusk, Howling Axe, Marrowdrinker, Mystbraver, Raging Aurochs, Stormbringer
Name Generator

entries.name: Age
entries: Halflings age at the same rate as humans.

entries.name: Size
entries: Halflings average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Lucky
entries: When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}, {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir}, or {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

entries.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Halfling.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and rarely live past 70.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Humans tend to no particular alignment by nature, although the aftermath of the Great War has made many of them bitter and resentful. One is as likely to find idealistic heroes as depraved villains among them, most of them fall somewhere in the middle.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary wildly in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in 3 extra skills of your choice.

entries.name: Natural Talent
entries: You gain one feat of your choice.

entries.name: Age
entries: Nessians age at the same rate as humans, but the blessing of the Scarlet Emperor gives them an increased lifespan and protects them from the worst effects of old age. A Nessian can live up to 90 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Lawful Evil. Nessian society is ruled by a rigid hierarchy, and rewards ambition, calculated risks, and ruthlessness above all.
In contrast, senseless cruelty and undignified behaviour are detested. However, there are those few who seek to oppose the Scarlet Emperor or, at the very least, look for a different lot in life.

entries.name: Size
entries: Nessians are about the same height and build as humans, not counting their horns, which can add up to a foot depending on shape. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: The blessing of the Emperor bestows upon you superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Fiendish Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to fire damage.

entries.name: Silvertongued
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Deception} skills.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Nessian.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Paladin, Wizard, Warlock

entries.name: Nessian Names
entries: Male Names: Andrakas, Casrakir, Kilros, Lokeus, Ozlech, Rolakos, Skavir, Thenon, Uriil, Zervenom
Female Names: Aralia, Brilaia, Creseis, Daki, Lerali, Pheyis, Seiriseis, Velspira, Yaseis, Zahala
Last Names: Abellan, Cabal, Espinar, Garrido, Illescas, Lacasa, Quesada, Tassis, Venegas, Xaudiera
First Name Generator
Last Name Generator

entries.name: Age
entries: Shadowborn do not age, and if not destroyed, can live forever.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Lawful Good. In contrast to their appearance most Shadowborn are virtuous and law-abiding beings that tend to work out of altruistic motives.

A typical Shadowborn takes great care to always conduct themselves in a polite manner and responds to likewise behaviour very favorably. Evil Shadowborn are usually dealt with swiftly by members of their own race, so as not to risk further worsening an already dangerously bad reputation.

entries.name: Size
entries: Shadowborn outside their armor can reach almost 7 feet in height, but typically weigh half as much as a humanoid of the same size. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your affinity to the Plane of Shadow grants you superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Unsleeping
entries: Shadowborn require neither food nor sleep. To sustain themselves they instead harness energy from the Shadowplane, for which they need to enter a state similar to deep meditation for 4 hours.

entries.name: Undead
entries: Shadowborn do not breathe, cannot benefit from regular healing, are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to Poison and Disease, and vulnerable to Radiant Damage.

entries.name: Siphon Shadows
entries: You are {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to necrotic damage. When you are subject to necrotic damage from any source except cantrips, you are instead healed for half the amount of the damage you would have taken.

entries.name: Siphon Life
entries: One of the things that contributes the most to the reputation Shadowborn have among other races, is their ability to harness residual life energy from the dead. For this reason, Shadowborn are very conscious of when they use this ability.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can siphon energy from a creature within 5 ft of you that has died within the last 24 hours. If you do so, you can spend hit dice as if you had taken a rest. You cannot use this feature more than once on the same creature.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Umbral.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Paladin, Rogue, Cleric

entries.name: Shadowborn Names
entries: Names: Balanced Truth, Harsh Justice, Honest Offer, Piercing Vision, Pointed Inquiry, Righteous Wrath, Silken Candor, Soundless Stride, Steadfast Loyalty, Umbral Journey

entries.name: Dwarven Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1 for each level.

entries.name: Dwarven Combat Training
entries: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in light and medium armor as well as the battleaxe, warhammer, light crossbow, and heavy crossbow.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Lawful Neutral. Most Mountain Dwarves are conservative and traditional, with strong emphasis on personal honor and loyalty. They tend to stay out of other's affairs and expect outsiders to do the same.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Fighter, Ranger, Cleric.

entries.name: Mountain Dwarf Names
entries: Male Names: Artyom, Klim, Mirov, Sergey, Stannis, Vadim, Viktor, Vladis, Yuri, Zhenyok
Female Names: Asya, Irina, Kataryna, Lapulya, Masha, Nashka, Natalya, Sanka, Sasha, Tatyana
Last Name: Name of father + ovich (M) or ovna (F)
Name Generator

entries.name: Crafty Negotiator
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill persuasion} skill.

entries.name: Insightful
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill insight} skill.

entries.name: Discerning Eye
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against Illusions and skill {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|checks} to identify illusions.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Neutral Good. Most Hill Dwarves love engaging in conversation and have a helpful streak. They see value in order and tradition like all dwarves, although personal ambition and pragmatism has greater importance to them.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Rogue, Cleric, or Sorcerer.

entries.name: Hill Dwarf Names
entries: Male Names: Borys, Fedir, Ihor, Kuzma, Oleh, Panas, Pylyp, Taras, Vitalij, Yehor
Female Names: Anzhela, Inna, Liliya, Marta, Orysya, Rayisa, Sofiya, Vita, Yeva, Zhanna
Last Name: Name of father + ovych (M) or ivna (F)
Name Generator

entries.name: High Elf Education
entries: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the Arcana skill and one more INT-based skill of your choice.

entries.name: Cantrip
entries: You know one cantrip of your choice from the cleric, wizard, or sorcerer spell list. Your spellcasting ability for it is INT, WIS, or CHA (your choice).

entries.name: Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write one additional language.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Lawful Evil. While not cruel, High Elves openly practice human slavery and justify it by placing their victims at a level with livestock. Arrogant and aloof, High Elves see themselves at the pinnacle of creation, though they do afford other powerful magic users a measure of respect.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Wizard, Cleric, Sorcerer

entries.name: High Elf Names
entries: Male Names: Coryth, Dadarai, Erethas, Fardarai, Irarion, Riarthas, Sarnaster, Tavtorin, Urilias, Xancorin
Female Names: Anzora, Faexana, Kairiel, Korariel, Lesthaea, Menairra, Satrianna, Theilynna, Velariel, Yllaneth
Last Name: Argentflower, Faefriend, Goldenlake, Leafwarder, Moongazer, Morningdew, Nightwarder, Springbreeze, Starspeaker, Sunseeker
Name Generator

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with the {@item elvish spear|Ishiir}, {@item greatspear|Ishiir}, {@item shortbow|Ishiir}, and {@item longbow|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Fleet of Foot
entries: Your base walking increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Born Predator
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to initiative.

entries.name: One with the Wild
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the nature skill.

entries.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you're only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Neutral. Most Wood Elf are stoic individuals that do not engage in conversation or take sides unless absolutely necessary. A Wood Elf will rarely deem an act evil or good, and instead judge it by its merit for survival.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Barbarian, Ranger, Druid

entries.name: Wood Elf Names
entries: Male Names: Admaris, Cralar, Farren, Genran, Norfaren, Pelpetor, Rojor, Theven, Vakian, Yelro
Female Names: Bryvyre, Chaeharice, Dawenys, Eilwynn, Iarnala, Mialynn, Quifiel, Syldi, Venrieth, Yescyne
Clan Name: Biting Arrow, Bloodsoaked Leaf, Hungering Blade, Lightless Song, Mighty Hawk, Raking Claw, Silent Crane, Soothing Hand, Unsleeping Myst, Warding Owl
Name Generator

entries.name: Dark Elf Spellcasting
entries: All Dark Elves enjoy the protection of their patron goddess. Excepting the cantrip, you can cast the following spells once per {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} without expending material components. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is WIS or CHA (your choice). You can also cast them using spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
{@spell Dancing Lights|Ishiir}, {@spell Sanctuary|Ishiir}, {@spell Healing Spirit|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Elf Weapon Training
entries: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with the {@item elvish sword|Ishiir}, {@item greatsword|Ishiir}, {@item longbow|Ishiir}, and {@item shortbow|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Lawful Neutral. Dark Elves live in a theocratic society that has laws and rituals for almost every aspect of life. Adhering to these and gaining favor in the eyes of their goddess is paramount for almost all of them.
They are cold and distrusting towards outsiders when encountered away from their city, but warm and hospitable when hosting them inside their walls.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Cleric, Ranger, Bard

entries.name: High Elf Names
entries: Male Names: Belthym, Gelas, Kyordan, Masmyr, Nalhriir, Nym, Pharaun, Ruathym, Veldrin, Xarann
Female Names: Aunquiri, Dileari, Faethra, Lirdbryn, Micarwae, Neerune, Quavwae, Rillay, Sindyrrith, T'rislindra
Last Name: Arabmtor, Auvryani, Baenrahel, Beltaulur, Despurden, Dryaalabban, Glannune, Mizzrym, Rilyntlar, Yril'Lysaen
Name Generator

entries.name: Nimble Dodge
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} against DEX {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.

entries.name: Friendly Face
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill persuasion} skill.

entries.name: Sneaky
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill stealth} skill.

entries.name: Light Steps
entries: You make any {@skill stealth} check that is contingent on not being heard rather than not being seen with {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: You can attempt to {@action hide|Ishiir} even if you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Neutral Good. Most Lightfoot Halflings are good-natured. They love making people laugh, meeting new friends and are quickly moved to action by another's plight. They do respect law, but are not above breaking it when it stands in the way of doing good in their eyes.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Rogue, Cleric, Bard

entries.name: Lightfoot Halfling Names
entries: Male Names: Davvias, Elwrick, Falbin, Flynyas, Janzin, Lineon, Marrich, Pimrin, Teamin, Yennad
Female Names: Antina, Calelle, Eieni, Eliree, Kithgrace, Maesira, Risica, Saeni, Trynnys, Zeneni
Last Name: Brushtumble, Dayglide, Havenvale, Hearthcrest, Heartwater, Manybarrel, Merrymouth, Riverpeak, Swiftheel, Thistlebrow
Name Generator

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against being {@condition Frightened|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Alert Senses
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in the {@skill perception} skill.

entries.name: Disciplined
entries: You can use heavy weapons despite being small.

entries.name: Strongheart Toughness
entries: Your hit point maximum increases by 1 for each level.

entries.name: Strongheart Weapon Training
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with light and medium armor as well as the {@item longsword|Ishiir}, {@item battleaxe|Ishiir}, {@item longbow|Ishiir}, and {@item crossbow, heavy|Ishiir|heavy crossbow}.

entries.name: Stout Resilience
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} against poison, and you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} against poison damage.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Lawful Neutral. Strongheart Halflings have strong ties to the Mountain Dwarves and emulate them in many ways. They do, however, not share their close allies' love for strong drink and a good fight. In fact, there aren't many things they do for sheer enjoyment, earning them a reputation of stoicism and being absolute killjoys at parties.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Fighter, Ranger, Paladin

entries.name: Strongheart Halfling Names
entries: Male Names: Arsire, Barster, Conric, Dannad, Norkas, Quinton, Sharder, Tedak, Ulsire, Uriras
Female Names: Belphina, Calwyn, Eovira, Gelkis, Hilsica, Isasira, Jilleigh, Thamgwen, Vafice, Xanvyre
Last Name: Argentshield, Bravewarder, Darkfender, Irongauntlet, Keenblade, Oathscabbard, Steelborn, Valorheart, Wallwatcher, Woodarcher
Name Generator

entries.name: Natural Illusionist
entries: You know the {@spell Minor Illusion|Ishiir} cantrip. Your spellcasting ability for it is INT, WIS, or CHA (your choice).

entries.name: Speak with Small Beasts
entries: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts. Forest gnomes love animals and often keep squirrels, badgers, rabbits, moles, woodpeckers, and other creatures as beloved pets.

entries.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: You can attempt to hide even if you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Chaotic Good. Flighty, ever curious and inquisitive, Forest Gnomes are good-hearted by nature, and will rarely venture down the path of evil. In fact, it requires terrible experiences and being removed from other gnomes for a long time for a Forest Gnome to become evil. Those that do, however, can be terrifying adversaries.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Rogue, Druid, Warlock

entries.name: Forest Gnome Names
entries: Male Names: Alxif, Erdri, Horwor, Langim, Manhik, Ordri, Poston, Ronwin, Vorziver, Xoni
Female Names: Banci, Breeyaris, Dossa, Inarhana, Krissa, Myssa, Orceli, Prixi, Qilin, Xassa
Last Name: Ayalala, Hooproll, Joyousjump, Naglin, Kribbledips, Oxenpot, Pickleprix, Shepperdale, Tibbitop, Zamzalah
Name Generator

entries.name: Expert Crafter
entries: You gain {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} in two tools of your choice.

entries.name: Artificer's Lore
entries: Whenever you make an INT-check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on the check.

entries.name: Gnome Tinkerer
entries: You have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with artisan's tools (tinker's tools). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp).

The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time. When you create a device, choose one of the following options or suggest an idea of your own to your DM.

items.name: Clockwork Toy
items.entry: This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.

items.name: Fire Starter
items.entry: The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.

items.name: Music Box
items.entry: When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Lawful Good. Like their cousins, Rock Gnomes are very friendly by nature, though living amongst humanoids for so long has given them a more pragmatic outlook on life. A Rock Gnome abhors lying and will always be honest in their dealings.

entries.name: Favored Classes
entries: Rogue, Artificer, Cleric

entries.name: Rock Gnome Names
entries: Male Names: Bracnill, Fraakneld, Gontir, Khirdrug, Krandell, Shothi, Sneti, Thoktill, Wolkull, Zhiddlin
Female Names: Almian, Buveda, Kanni, Lalgi, Nirshaili, Sirsei, Turthira, Uthrieri, Yilselka, Zuslenn
Last Name: Chalkmarker, Coalfurnace, Flintstriker, Granitesplitter, Onyxeye, Pebblesorter, Quartzgrinder, Rockmelder, Stonechisel, Whetstone
Name Generator
